intro: Stegnogramma pozoi subsp. mollissima, commonly known as the silky stegnogramma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the islands of Cuba and Hispaniola. This subspecies is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant's foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
